WorkSession models¶

This model will store the information relating to sessions and the total billable per each session.

A session is considered to be the amount of work that was done in a time. An example of this could be a meeting, a planning session, working a piece of functionality, or writing tests/documentation, etc.

All sessions of work most be carried out as a part of a project. The project determines the rate of pay and any other additional information related to the project.

class work_sessions.models.Session(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The session model

Stores information about the length of the individual sessions, and the total billable for each session.

Parameters:
  • date (date) – The date the session occured on
  • duration (timedelate) – The length of time that this work was carried
  • for (out) –
  • total_billable (float) – The total amount of money that was earned for
  • work session (this) –
  • project (Project) – The project that this work was carried out for
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

WorkSession serializers¶

This module is the serializers that will map to any models defined in this package.

class work_sessions.serializers.SessionSerializer(instance=None, data=<class 'rest_framework.fields.empty'>, **kwargs)[source]¶

The session serializer

Serializes all of the fields in the Session model

WorkSession views¶

The session views module.

All of the interactions with the sessions models will happen through the views defined here. In general, these views will require authentication as this is sensitive information that likely shouldn’t be shared with anyone.

class work_sessions.views.SessionViewset(**kwargs)[source]¶

The session viewset

The view that will handle the interactions with the Session model. This viewset is ReadOnly as records will generally be automated and can also be created in the admin panel. As of yet there is no requirement to create sessions from this view.

Returns:Returns an array of JSON objects containing the fields specified in the serializer_class
Return type:JSON Array
serializer_class¶

alias of work_sessions.serializers.SessionSerializer

Projects models¶

The models for the Projects app.

These models will house any and all information relating to a project

A project is considered to be a specific project that you are working on. For example, you may be working on one, or many projects for a company, and each project may have a specific hourly rate.

class projects.models.Project(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Projects will have a name and and an hourly rate

Parameters:
  • name (str) – The name of the project being worked on
  • rate (int) – The hourly rate being earned
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Projects views¶

The projects views module.

All of the interactions with the projects models will happen through the views defined here. In general, these views will require authentication as this is sensitive information that likely shouldn’t be shared with anyone.

The projects viewset

The view that will handle the interactions with the Projects model. This viewset is ReadOnly as records will generally be automated and can also be created in the admin panel. As of yet there is no requirement to create projects from this view.

Invoices models¶

Model module

The models for the invoices app. This model will keep track of all of the existing invoices, and once the invoice cron task is run, a new record will be generated here

class invoices.models.Invoice(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Invoice model

This model will keep track of the invoices, their numbers, due dates, etc.

Each new invoice will be generated with a new unique value, as well as a list of the sessions and the total value of all of the work completed.

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Invoices utils.auth¶

auth.py

A wrapper over Googles authentication.

invoices.utils.auth.authenticate()[source]¶

Authenticates against Google

This function wraps up the authentication for the Google API. This will allow programmatic access to Google Sheets and Google Drive. The creds are read from the CREDS_LOCATION setting.

Returns:A client object that will be used to communicate with the API provided by gspread
Return type:client (Client)

Invoices utils.sheet¶

sheet.py

Handle the formatting of the Google Sheet

class invoices.utils.sheet.SheetFormatMixin[source]¶

A mixin class that will provide the mapping and formatting for the Google Sheet. This is the class that will define where each piece of information belongs on the invoice

format_header()[source]¶

Format the header of the invoice.

Turns the first row of the invoice blue

Invoices management¶

generate_invoice.py

This command will be used generate a new invoice in Google Sheets every month.
